name: Football for Dummies #1 Trivia Quiz | Worldwide  Football | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which England legend had the nickname of the "Lion of Vienna"?
questions.explanation:
Nat Lofthouse.

	Lofthouse was given the nickname after an amazing display for England in a 3-2 win over Austria in 1952. He played his whole career with Bolton Wanderers, and scored 30 goals in 33 international games for England. None of the others listed were born when this game took place.

questions.text: Which player transferred from PSV Eindhoven to Barcelona in July, 1996?
questions.explanation:
Ronaldo.

	Ronaldo played for Barcelona for just one season, scoring 34 goals in 37 games before moving to Italian giants, Inter Milan. Romario played for Barcelona between 1993-97. Maradona between 1982-86, and Koeman between 1989-95.

questions.text: Who did Alex Ferguson replace as manager of Manchester United in 1986?
questions.explanation:
Ron Atkinson.

	Ferguson was knighted in 1999 for his services in football. Atkinson was United's manager between 1981-86. Sexton was manager between 1977-81, and Docherty, 1972-77.

questions.text: Who were the last ever champions of the old fourth division in English football before the introduction of the Premier League? (1991-92)
questions.explanation:
Burnley.

	Burnley won the old fourth division with 83 points from 42 games. Brentford were Division Three champions that season with 82 points from 46 games. Ipswich were Division Two champions with 84 points from 46 games, and Leeds were Division One champions with 82 points from 42 games.

questions.text: Which international team won the first World Cup in 1930?
questions.explanation:
Uruguay.

	Uruguay beat Argentina 4-2 in Montevideo, Uruguay to lift the first ever World Cup. Only 13 countries played in this tournament, which were: Argentina, Belgium, Bolivia, Brazil, Chile, France, Mexico, Paraguay, Peru, Romania, Uruguay, United States, and Yugoslavia.

questions.text: For what is FIFA the acronym?
questions.explanation:
Federation Internationale de Football Association.

	FIFA is the world governing body of soccer, which means that any law passed by them has to be undertaken by every country within the Federation. FIFA was established in 1904.

questions.text: For which US team did Pele once play?
questions.explanation:
New York Cosmos.

	Pele, probably the greatest footballer of all time, played for the Cosmos between 1975-77, and ended his professional career there.

questions.text: Who captained Manchester United to European Cup glory in 1999?
questions.explanation:
Peter Schmeichel.

	Schmeichel was stand-in skipper for Roy Keane, who was suspended for the game, in which United triumphed 2-1 over Bayern Munich. Cantona and Robson had left Old Trafford by the time this final came about, and both were retired as players.

questions.text: Which team won the first English Football League title in 1889?
questions.explanation:
Preston North End.

	Preston won the League without losing a single game, and took the FA Cup that season also. None of the others listed participated in the inaugural League championship.

questions.text: Who became the first black player to appear for England in 1978?
questions.explanation:
Viv Anderson.

	Anderson was a Nottingham Forest player when he appeared in an England shirt against Czechoslovakia in 1978. Barnes didn't make his debut until 1983 against Northern Ireland. Sinclair played for the first time for England in 2001 against Sweden, and Ince in 1992 against Spain.
